channel.title: CLIENT: Removing
channel.description:
I'm trying to remove 3 things from my client login here is a picture that I took, it shows what I wont removed.
[img]http://i700.photobucket.com/albums/ww8/f2pscape/helpmeplease.jpg[/img]
If any one can help me that would be great =)
Thank-you. :D

item.title: CLIENT: Removing
item.dc:creator: @monkey_money30 monkey money30
item.description:
@monkey_money30 wrote:

How do I remove the flames, there are NO things saying what to do.

Read full topic

item.title: CLIENT: Removing
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

[quote=“monkey money30, post:11, topic:289800”]Yea I got it just before you posted again, lol, umm how does it even work???

It doesn’t make scence…[/quote]

Experiment around.

First off…Click file…Load cache…“The file with your cache in it”

Look for the logo and when you find it, change it.

Read full topic

item.title: CLIENT: Removing
item.dc:creator: @monkey_money30 monkey money30
item.description:
@monkey_money30 wrote:

[quote=“dillingo, post:5, topic:289800”][quote author=monkey money30 link=topic=383088.msg2876507#msg2876507 date=1248074785]

I’m pretty sure they’re in the cache. Just remove or edit them.

Yes I think I may have figured they are in Cache, But what would there file names be?
[/quote]
First off your going to need a cache editor if you don’t already have one. I recomend Tom’s. I know the RS logo is in the Image Archives under Title named ‘logo.dat’. You’re just gonna have to look for the fire, but it shouldn’t be hard to find.[/quote]

Wait, Where do I find the cache editor?

Read full topic

item.title: CLIENT: Removing
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

But I did explain a few different things, and yes I read it and understood what you posted before I posted.

Read full topic

item.title: CLIENT: Removing
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

[quote=“Setsuna, post:3, topic:289800”]There’s a tut somewhere on removing the flames, don’t know much about them. Sorry.

As for the logo, there’s a few ways to do that. I suggest through cache editing.[/quote]

[quote=“Telenim, post:6, topic:289800”]I think there was a tutorial on adding the flames - I’m not sure if it goes for the same way back-going the tutorial and removing what it tells you to add.

For the logo, there is a cache editor which is released in the client hacking section, download that extract it and do what Dillingo said (you might be able to find the flames in the cache editor, as well).[/quote]

I love when the same thing get’s stated twice… :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.title: CLIENT: Removing
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

I think there was a tutorial on adding the flames - I’m not sure if it goes for the same way back-going the tutorial and removing what it tells you to add.

For the logo, there is a cache editor which is released in the client hacking section, download that extract it and do what Dillingo said (you might be able to find the flames in the cache editor, as well).

Read full topic

item.title: CLIENT: Removing
item.dc:creator: @dillingo dillingo
item.description:
@dillingo wrote:

[quote=“monkey money30, post:4, topic:289800”][quote author=dillingo link=topic=383088.msg2876504#msg2876504 date=1248074543]
I’m pretty sure they’re in the cache. Just remove or edit them.
[/quote]
Yes I think I may have figured they are in Cache, But what would there file names be?[/quote]
First off your going to need a cache editor if you don’t already have one. I recomend Tom’s. I know the RS logo is in the Image Archives under Title named ‘logo.dat’. You’re just gonna have to look for the fire, but it shouldn’t be hard to find.

Read full topic
